intro: Zehneria emirnensis, commonly known as the Emirnensis Zehneria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Zehneria emirnensis is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often in high-altitude environments.
